1122120666491314176.text: ProgPoW is ASIC-able. By removing the tensor cores, caches, 3D logic, etc from a GPU, ProgPoW ASICs can achieve at least a 2.5x speedup over GPUs, exactly the same as Ethash. It's ill conceived, won't increase decentralization or prevent ASICs, and will increase 51% attack risk.https://twitter.com/EthCatHerders/status/1121890121173827592 …

2. The moon landing was not faked
3. Everyone in the world can't propagate, validate, and permanently archive a GB block in less time than it takes before the next one comes

1078695971884883968.text: Unpopular opinion: "The perfect is the enemy of the good" is weaponized laziness.

1123194014906372096.text: This is wrong. You should combine all hashrate *capable* of mining a chain. This means that BCH, BSV require infinite confs (because > 51% of hashrate is on BTC) and GPU-mined coins like ETH, ZCash, Monero should be combined when calculating confshttps://twitter.com/lukechilds/status/1122830318099025920 …

1122539478692892673.text:
It's not necessary to make a shitcoin and actually demonstrate the failure in order to make good decisions about it.

Of course, not everyone will believe you. It's important that Bitcoin isn't a democracy and wiser minds can make technical decisions.

1122477737334202368.text: The physical law you claim to be able to break is the speed of light:Latency and validation generate orphans. Too many orphans prevent the chain from making forward progress. BSV had a 6-block reorg after a 128MB block, and a GB block is foolish. Bitcoin wisely rejected this fatehttps://twitter.com/PeterRizun/status/1122191376450383874 …
